column4: any reason that should not work here btw? used to work fine in hardy, after upgrade smb:// links give me an error
nautilus-share is already the newest version.
the nautilus-share package is installed, any other ideas?
are you using an ip or name in the address ?
IP did work, any particular reason why? and... any way around using IP all the time?
this is due to name resolving , add search LAN in your /etc/resolv.conf file using sudo
then try using names after that
resolv already has search mydomain, is that not enough?
just add LAN after mydomain , seperated by single space
Yep, that did the trick, great :) Cheers man!
nmap is in network tools, port scanner
i dont even have network tools
ah, didnt realise that uses nmap, but still there does not seem to be a way to change any settings (and id rather use it with cli tbh)
